wikipedia_page.main:
John Burland Harris-Burland (1870-1926) was a British writer, known for his early fantasy stories.
He was born in 1870 in Aldershot, the son of Major General William Burland Harris-Burland, decorated for his part in the Crimean War.,He attended Sherborne School, but due to health reasons could not enter a military career like his father, so he studied at a theological college, intending to become a clergyman, before changing his mind and entering Exeter College. In 1893 his poem "Amy Roberts" won the Newdigate Prize. His first novel was the 1903 "Dacobra, or the White Priests of Ahriman".
He died in 1926.
